div.title: Her Majesty (lyrics)
div.pre: This is the Timing + transcript used in the tiddler HerMajesty |2.274|Her Majesty's a pretty nice girl| |4.435|But She Doesn't Have a Lot to say| |7.003|Her Majesty's a pretty nice girl| |9.125|But she changes from day to day| |12.073|I wanna tell her that I love her a lot| |14.016|But I gotta get a belly full of wine| |16.49|Her Majesty's a pretty nice girl| |18.739|Some day I wanna make her mine,| |20.899|Oh yeah| |21.339|Some day I wanna make her mine.|

div.title: YouTubePlugin documentation
div.pre:
The YouTubePlugin defines the macro ''youtube'', which in its simples form takes just one parameter, the id of a youtube video. Used like this, It will embed the video in the page at the place where it is used. For example, you can simply write {{{ <<youtube vHI9BTpGkp8>> }}} in stead of [[this|Youtube embedding code sample]] in order to achieve this:
<<youtube YrLk4vdY28Q>>
The parameter is the portion of the youtube URL between ''?v='' and the first ''&'' (if you take it from the browser address bar).
You may have noticed (depending on the with of your browser window), that the youtube macro will - by default - size the player window to the width of the story coulumn. If you would rather have it appear at a fixed size, you can add a second parameter specifying the with in pixels, like this: {{{<<youtube YrLk4vdY28Q 300>>}}}.
<<youtube YrLk4vdY28Q 300>>
If the video is in wide-screen format, you will want to add a subparameter after the width, being the aspect ratio in percent, that is the height in percent of the width: {{{<<youtube P_NpxTWbovE 350,67%>>}}}
<<youtube P_NpxTWbovE 350,67%>>
You can omit the width part and just specify the aspect ratio, like I do in this next example, which uses an additional option, which is to specify a label which is rendered as link text in stead of the player being embedded immediately. The reader can then chose to click the link and have the play open: {{{<<youtube 7muBBSQniho 300 label "Amy MacDonald's version">>}}}. <<youtube 7muBBSQniho 300 label "Amy MacDonald's version">> starts late but, but bear with her, it's not half bad.
Perhaps you would like the player to start playing immediately, just add the keyword ''play'', as in [[this example|Her Majesty]] which also illustrates two additional features of the youtube macro.

div.title: Youtube embedding code sample
YouTubePlugin
SWFObjectPlugin
MeAndMyUncle
div.pre:
|<>|Me and my uncle came riding down
From Colorado, West Texas bound|

div.title: Her Majesty
div.pre: <html><div id='tslocation' class='transcriptClass'/></html> <<youtube J070ZJIBX-o 300,67% chromeless play transcript "Her Majesty (lyrics)" tslocation>> <html><div id='tslocation' class='transcriptClass'/></html>

div.title: MeAndMyUncle intro
div.pre: Joni Mitchell was probably the first to <<youtube Zp3lJg07u4w 300 'perform it on TV' play>>.
